text: we went from a very scrappy startup
deployment in a data center to something
where we had an opportunity to
completely redo everything we started
from scratch and we had a lot of lofty
goals in mind and we achieved everyone
with AWS creative market is a place
where people come to buy and sell
mousemaid design assets things like
WordPress themes and graphic plug-ins
for Photoshop creative market has
roughly 3 million users right now with
about 20,000 shop owners in 2014 we were
acquired by Autodesk and moved here into
their offices in San Francisco something
that I love about creative market is
people are making lives off of our
marketplace platform that we offer not
just measly lives had some people are
doing really really well we've seen some
tremendous growth in some of the shop
owners a few people that actually become
millionaires on the site our IT
environment prior to moving to AWS we
were deployed in a traditional data
center we were in SoftLayer so the
biggest challenges we were facing with
our infrastructure is really the
inflexibility to do pretty much
everything this is the typical story of
things taking several weeks to get done
that we can now get done in minutes to
try to replicate what we have in AWS now
in a traditional environment would
require I can't imagine how many more
pan hours people racking servers people
running cat5e you know and that's
something that we don't have to worry
about but simply we run everything we
can in AWS we run our production staging
and development environment we also run
our analytics data bases on redshift
some of the biggest things that we can
do now would be like auto scaling not
even an option
prior to make a AWS we needed to have
shared file storage between all our
instances that we have in production all
of our application servers we originally
stood up a cluster cluster and it
immediately started to show so the
issues that eventually became real
problems for us mainly around automating
things if we needed to automate failover
we needed to say I capacity on the fly
or anything like that we only really had
one engineer who understood it well
enough to work on at any given time so
if he was out or on vacation and
something went wrong it was like what
do it was simply a nightmare for me to
build out operate and scale over time so
we knew we needed to replace it with
something much better when we move to
EFS all those problems went away when we
first heard about EFS we could not wait
to get our hands on it given its
simplicity of setup and operation I mean
you don't even have to tell it how much
storage you need you just use the
storage you get billed for it and delete
the files and it's taken care of
livings we do heavily as we resize
images on the fly we store all the
original size images within EFS and when
someone requests it we basically resize
it on the fly sent to them that's
wrapped in a CDN so the next time it's
access it just gets pulled from the CDN
whenever we push a new version of the
website a new version of the application
it goes out to DFS and then that gets
read across and copied to all of our
application and we're actually paying 95
percent less for the same storage I'm
not enough to hire another engineer for
you with the FS file storage has gone
from one of our biggest pains to one of
our smallest we no longer lose sleep
worrying about our storage
infrastructure going down and all of
that time can be spent working on
projects that are much more valuable to
the business being on AWS has made my
job quite a bit easier because all my
team and my engineers can stay focused
on things that bring value to the
business
now that the developers can have their
own individual development environment
that more truly mirror production and
staging they are able to be more
confident that the product that they're
developing against will deploy
successfully when it comes time to go to
production we're growing very quickly
and people are storing a lot of products
on our platform we want to be able to
support very large product files for our
users in the future into the tens of
terabytes if need be it's pretty easy to
say that I wouldn't have the engineering
team I have right now if we weren't on
AWS
a lot of Engineers just won't work on
these types of infrastructure problems
unless they're on AWS it's just there's
too much value there we're basically
never looking back you know we're very
proud to be on AWS
